intro: Justicia plowmanii, commonly known as the flame flower, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States and parts of Mexico. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its showy, tubular red or orange flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows as a herbaceous perennial, reaching heights of up to 3 feet, with lance-shaped leaves that are opposite on the stem. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and requires well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for gardens and landscapes. The flowers attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies, contributing to its ecological value.
